doc.after: Smelting of iron ore into steel consumes 55% of commercially produced oxygen.[44] In this process, O 2 is injected through a high-pressure lance into molten iron, which removes sulfur impurities and excess carbon as the respective oxides, SO 2 and CO 2. The reactions are exothermic, so the temperature increases to 1,700Â Â°C.[44]
